item.title: The K-shaped economy is carrying a ticking time bomb into 2026
item.description: "I've never seen anything like it," KPMG's chief economist Diane Swonk told Fortune.

item.title: The Powerball prize now stands at $1.7 billion. Here are the biggest jackpots in history—and where the winning tickets were sold
item.description: The U.S. has seen more than a dozen lottery jackpot prizes exceed $1 billion since 2016.

item.title: How investment giant Vanguard’s CIO is placing big tech bets today to create the AI digital advisor of tomorrow
item.description: Vanguard CIO Nitin Tandon says AI can be used to hyper-personalize guidance for customers.

item.title: American Jews, Chinese food and Christmas: The first connection was a 1935 gift of chow mein to a New Jersey orphanage
item.description: Elena Kagan was asked where she was on Christmas during her Supreme Court confirmation: “Like all Jews, I was probably at a Chinese restaurant.”

item.title: CEO of a $134 billion software giant blasts companies with billions in funding but zero revenue: ‘That’s clearly a bubble, right… it’s, like, insane’
item.description: Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi says he's hearing from venture capitalists "maybe I should just go on a break for, like, six months" to let the bubble simme...
